byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and NICHOLAS CASEY
byline.contributor: Kirk Semple reported from Medellín, and Nicholas Casey from New York. Paula Duran contributed reporting from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: After the defeat of a peace deal, the range of possibilities is dizzying, from quick talks to produce an amended agreement to an effort to rewrite the Constitution.

headline.print_headline: Colombia and Rebels Want Peace, but Path Is Less Clear Than Ever
headline.main: Colombia and Rebels Want Peace, but How Has Never Been Less Clear.

snippet: After the defeat of a peace deal, the range of possibilities is dizzying, from quick talks to produce an amended agreement to an effort to rewrite the Constitution....
abstract: Colombian voters' rejection of peace accord with Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia throws future of country and conflict into uncertainty; both sides hope to maintain truce and government is faced with many options, from quickly renegotiating accord to rewriting Constitution.
